member.summary: Provides helper methods that supplement the .

member.summary: Instantiates an object of the given type.

member.name: T:slf4net.Configuration.FactoryConfigurationElement
member.summary: The factory element within the application configuration.

member.name: M:slf4net.Configuration.FactoryConfigurationElement.OnDeserializeUnrecognizedElement(System.String,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Parses custom factory data into the property, if refers to a factory-data element.
member.returns: True if the element is a (supported) factory-data element. If it's an other unexpected element, this method returns false.

member.name: P:slf4net.Configuration.FactoryConfigurationElement.FactoryData
member.summary: Gets custom factory data, if available. This is data of the factory element, that is wrapped into an element named factory-data. The contents of the factory-data element can be as simple as a literal, or a complex XML element. Defaults to null.
member.example:
The following example shows two possible configurations - one with a literal as custom configuration data, one with XML based configuration:
<slf> <!-- a factory configuration with literal content --> <factory name="simple"> <factory-data> simple data </factory-data> </factory>
<!-- a factory configuration with XML sub elements --> <factory name="complex"> <factory-data> <child foo="bar"> <subchild>foobar</subchild> </child> </factory-data> </factory> </slf>

member.name: P:slf4net.Configuration.FactoryConfigurationElement.Type
member.summary: Indicates the factory Type

member.summary: The slf4net configuration section to define which type to use.

member.name: T:slf4net.NOPLogger
member.summary:
A no operation implementation of the interface, which doesn't log anything. Use this implementation in order not to have to check for null references when using an .
This logger implementation is a Singleton. You can get the singleton instance through the property.

member.name: M:slf4net.Resolvers.AppConfigFactoryResolver.CreateFactoryInstance(slf4net.Configuration.FactoryConfigurationElement)
